meanings.definition: Try hard to do or achieve something.
meanings.sent1: She will endeavour to finish her homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: I always endeavour to be kind to others.
meanings.sent3: In her endeavour to bake a cake, she accidentally used salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: His endeavour to climb the mountain was met with unexpected challenges.
meanings.sent5: The young athlete's endeavour to break the record inspired many.

meanings.definition: An attempt to achieve a goal.
meanings.sent1: His latest endeavour to learn a new language is impressive.
meanings.sent2: The team's collective endeavour led to a successful project completion.
meanings.sent3: The cat's endeavour to catch the laser pointer light provided endless entertainment.
meanings.sent4: Her endeavour to start a small business blossomed into a thriving company.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut's risky endeavour to explore the unknown captivated the world.
